Root.name: BaseVoltage
Root.Comment: Defines a system base voltage which is referenced.

ComplexType.name: ConductingEquipment
ComplexType.Comment: The parts of the power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals.

Reference.name: BaseVoltage
Reference.Comment: Base voltage of this conducting equipment. Use only when there is no voltage level container used and only one base voltage applies. For example, not used for transformers.

Root.name: ConnectivityNode
Root.Comment: Connectivity nodes are points where terminals of conducting equipment are connected together with zero impedance.

Reference.name: TopologicalNode
Reference.Comment: The topological node to which this connectivity node is assigned. May depend on the current state of switches in the network.

Root.name: ConnectivityNodeContainer
Root.Comment: A base class for all objects that may contain connectivity nodes or topological nodes.

ComplexType.name: Equipment
ComplexType.Comment: The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanical.

Simple.name: aggregate
Simple.Comment: The single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modeled together as an aggregate. Examples would be power transformers or sychronous machines operating in parallel modeled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. This is not to be used to indicate equipment that is part of a group of interdependent equipment produced by a network production program.

Simple.name: normallyInService
Simple.Comment: If true, the equipment is normally in service.

ComplexType.name: IdentifiedObject
ComplexType.Comment: This is a root class to provide common identification for all classes needing identification and naming attributes.

Simple.name: mRID
Simple.Comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is globally unique within an exchange context.
Global uniqeness is easily achived by using a UUID for the mRID. It is strongly recommended to do this.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

Simple.name: aliasName
Simple.Comment: The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

Simple.name: name
Simple.Comment: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

ComplexType.name: PowerSystemResource
ComplexType.Comment: A power system resource can be an item of equipment such as a switch, an equipment container containing many individual items of equipment such as a substation, or an organisational entity such as sub-control area. Power system resources can have measurements associated.

Root.name: Switch
Root.Comment: A generic device designed to close, or open, or both, one or more electric circuits.

Simple.name: normalOpen
Simple.Comment: The attribute is used in cases when no Measurement for the status value is present. If the Switch has a status measurment the Discrete.normalValue is expected to match with the Switch.normalOpen.

Simple.name: retained
Simple.Comment: Branch is retained in a bus branch model.

Simple.name: switchOnCount
Simple.Comment: The switch on count since the switch was last reset or initialized.

Simple.name: switchOnDate
Simple.Comment: The date and time when the switch was last switched on.

Reference.name: ratedCurrent
Reference.Comment: The maximum continuous current carrying capacity in amps governed by the device material and construction.

Root.name: Terminal
Root.Comment: An electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

Reference.name: ConductingEquipment
Reference.Comment: The conducting equipment of the terminal. Conducting equipment have terminals that may be connected to other conducting equipment terminals via connectivity nodes or topological nodes.

Reference.name: ConnectivityNode
Reference.Comment: The connectivity node to which this terminal connects with zero impedance.

Root.name: TopologicalNode
Root.Comment: For a detailed substation model a topological node is a set of connectivity nodes that, in the current network state, are connected together through any type of closed switches, including jumpers. Topological nodes change as the current network state changes (i.e., switches, breakers, etc. change state).

For a planning model, switch statuses are not used to form topological nodes. Instead they are manually created or deleted in a model builder tool. Topological nodes maintained this way are also called "busses".
